testcase.name: ERC721 1. Initialize 1.1. Should assign states successfully
testcase.classname: 1.1. Should assign states successfully

testcase.name: ERC721 2. Mint 2.1. Should be fail when recipient address is zero address
testcase.classname: 2.1. Should be fail when recipient address is zero address

testcase.name: ERC721 2. Mint 2.2. Should be fail when recipient address is a contract address
testcase.classname: 2.2. Should be fail when recipient address is a contract address

testcase.name: ERC721 2. Mint 2.3. Should be fail when token URI is empty
testcase.classname: 2.3. Should be fail when token URI is empty

testcase.name: ERC721 2. Mint 2.4. Should be fail when amount is equal 0
testcase.classname: 2.4. Should be fail when amount is equal 0

testcase.name: ERC721 2. Mint 2.5. Should be fail when price is equal 0
testcase.classname: 2.5. Should be fail when price is equal 0

testcase.name: ERC721 2. Mint 2.6. Should be fail when amount is less than price
testcase.classname: 2.6. Should be fail when amount is less than price

testcase.name: ERC721 2. Mint 2.7. Should be fail when user pays native token and msg.value is not equal amount
testcase.classname: 2.7. Should be fail when user pays native token and msg.value is not equal amount

testcase.name: ERC721 2. Mint 2.8. Should be fail when user pays cash test token and payment token is not a contract address
testcase.classname: 2.8. Should be fail when user pays cash test token and payment token is not a contract address

testcase.name: ERC721 2. Mint 2.9. Should be fail when local government address is zero address
testcase.classname: 2.9. Should be fail when local government address is zero address

testcase.name: ERC721 2. Mint 2.10. Should be fail when local government address is a contract address
testcase.classname: 2.10. Should be fail when local government address is a contract address

testcase.name: ERC721 2. Mint 2.11. Should be fail when transaction is not signed by verifier
testcase.classname: 2.11. Should be fail when transaction is not signed by verifier

testcase.name: ERC721 2. Mint 2.12. Should mint successfully when user pays native token
testcase.classname: 2.12. Should mint successfully when user pays native token

testcase.name: ERC721 2. Mint 2.13. Should mint successfully when user pays cash test token
testcase.classname: 2.13. Should mint successfully when user pays cash test token

testcase.name: ERC721 3. Set Admin 3.1. Should be fail when caller is not the owner
testcase.classname: 3.1. Should be fail when caller is not the owner

testcase.name: ERC721 3. Set Admin 3.2. Should be fail when setting zero address
testcase.classname: 3.2. Should be fail when setting zero address

testcase.name: ERC721 3. Set Admin 3.3. Should be fail when setting contract address
testcase.classname: 3.3. Should be fail when setting contract address

testcase.name: ERC721 3. Set Admin 3.4. Should set successfully
testcase.classname: 3.4. Should set successfully

testcase.name: ERC721 4. Set Verifier 4.1. Should be fail when caller is not the owner
testcase.classname: 4.1. Should be fail when caller is not the owner

testcase.name: ERC721 4. Set Verifier 4.2. Should be fail when setting zero address
testcase.classname: 4.2. Should be fail when setting zero address

testcase.name: ERC721 4. Set Verifier 4.3. Should be fail when setting a contract address
testcase.classname: 4.3. Should be fail when setting a contract address

testcase.name: ERC721 4. Set Verifier 4.4. Should set successfully
testcase.classname: 4.4. Should set successfully

testcase.name: ERC721 5. Set Token URI 5.1. Should be fail when token ID is nonexistent
testcase.classname: 5.1. Should be fail when token ID is nonexistent

testcase.name: ERC721 5. Set Token URI 5.2. Should be fail when new token URI is empty
testcase.classname: 5.2. Should be fail when new token URI is empty

testcase.name: ERC721 5. Set Token URI 5.3. Should be fail when transaction is not signed by verifier
testcase.classname: 5.3. Should be fail when transaction is not signed by verifier

testcase.name: ERC721 5. Set Token URI 5.4. Should be fail when signature data is invalid
testcase.classname: 5.4. Should be fail when signature data is invalid

testcase.name: ERC721 5. Set Token URI 5.5. Should set successfully
testcase.classname: 5.5. Should set successfully

testcase.name: ERC721 6. Withdraw 6.1. Should be fail when caller is not owner
testcase.classname: 6.1. Should be fail when caller is not owner

testcase.name: ERC721 6. Withdraw 6.2. Should be fail when recipient address is zero addess
testcase.classname: 6.2. Should be fail when recipient address is zero addess

testcase.name: ERC721 6. Withdraw 6.3. Should be fail when amount is equal 0
testcase.classname: 6.3. Should be fail when amount is equal 0

testcase.name: ERC721 6. Withdraw 6.4. Should be fail when owner withdraw native token amount greater than withdrawable amount
testcase.classname: 6.4. Should be fail when owner withdraw native token amount greater than withdrawable amount

testcase.name: ERC721 6. Withdraw 6.5. Should be fail when owner withdraw test cash token amount greater than withdrawable amount
testcase.classname: 6.5. Should be fail when owner withdraw test cash token amount greater than withdrawable amount

testcase.name: ERC721 6. Withdraw 6.6. Should be successful when owner withdraws native token
testcase.classname: 6.6. Should be successful when owner withdraws native token

testcase.name: ERC721 6. Withdraw 6.7. Should be successful when owner withdraws cash test token
testcase.classname: 6.7. Should be successful when owner withdraws cash test token

testcase.name: ERC721 7. Transfer 7.1. Should be fail when sender transfer token to self
testcase.classname: 7.1. Should be fail when sender transfer token to self

testcase.name: ERC721 7. Transfer 7.2. Should be fail when recipient address is zero address
testcase.classname: 7.2. Should be fail when recipient address is zero address

testcase.name: ERC721 7. Transfer 7.3. Should be fail when token is nonexistent
testcase.classname: 7.3. Should be fail when token is nonexistent

testcase.name: ERC721 7. Transfer 7.4. Should be fail when type of token is not "Normal"
testcase.classname: 7.4. Should be fail when type of token is not "Normal"

testcase.name: ERC721 7. Transfer 7.5. Should be fail when token is not owned by sender
testcase.classname: 7.5. Should be fail when token is not owned by sender

testcase.name: ERC721 7. Transfer 7.6. Should transfer successfully
testcase.classname: 7.6. Should transfer successfully

testcase.name: ERC721 8. Buy 8.1. Should be fail when buy a nonexistent token
testcase.classname: 8.1. Should be fail when buy a nonexistent token

testcase.name: ERC721 8. Buy 8.2. Should be fail when buy an owned token
testcase.classname: 8.2. Should be fail when buy an owned token

testcase.name: ERC721 8. Buy 8.3. Should be fail when type of token is not normal
testcase.classname: 8.3. Should be fail when type of token is not normal

testcase.name: ERC721 8. Buy 8.4. Should be successful when user buys a token paid by native token
testcase.classname: 8.4. Should be successful when user buys a token paid by native token

testcase.name: ERC721 8. Buy 8.5. Should be successful when user buys a token paid by test cash token
testcase.classname: 8.5. Should be successful when user buys a token paid by test cash token

testcase.name: ERC721 9. Donate 9.1. Should be fail when token is nonexistent
testcase.classname: 9.1. Should be fail when token is nonexistent

testcase.name: ERC721 9. Donate 9.2. Should be fail when caller does not own token
testcase.classname: 9.2. Should be fail when caller does not own token

testcase.name: ERC721 9. Donate 9.3. Should be fail when type of token is not "Furusato" or "Donated"
testcase.classname: 9.3. Should be fail when type of token is not "Furusato" or "Donated"

testcase.name: ERC721 9. Donate 9.4. Should donate successfully
testcase.classname: 9.4. Should donate successfully

testcase.name: ERC721 10. Get Token URI 10.1. Should be fail when get a token is nonexistent
testcase.classname: 10.1. Should be fail when get a token is nonexistent

testcase.name: ERC721 10. Get Token URI 10.2. Should return exactly token URI
testcase.classname: 10.2. Should return exactly token URI

testcase.name: ERC721 10. Get Token URI 10.3. Should retrieve exacty token URI after setting token URI
testcase.classname: 10.3. Should retrieve exacty token URI after setting token URI

testcase.name: Verify Signature 1. Verify Mint 1.1. Should verify fail when signer is wrong
testcase.classname: 1.1. Should verify fail when signer is wrong

testcase.name: Verify Signature 1. Verify Mint 1.2. Should verify fail when data is wrong
testcase.classname: 1.2. Should verify fail when data is wrong

testcase.name: Verify Signature 1. Verify Mint 1.3. Should verify successfully
testcase.classname: 1.3. Should verify successfully

testcase.name: Verify Signature 2. Verify Set Token URI 2.1. Should verify fail when signer is wrong
testcase.classname: 2.1. Should verify fail when signer is wrong

testcase.name: Verify Signature 2. Verify Set Token URI 1.2. Should verify fail when data is wrong
testcase.classname: 1.2. Should verify fail when data is wrong

testcase.name: Verify Signature 2. Verify Set Token URI 1.3. Should verify successfully
testcase.classname: 1.3. Should verify successfully

testcase.name: Verify Signature 3. Verify Set Type Of Token 3.1. Should verify fail when signer is wrong
testcase.classname: 3.1. Should verify fail when signer is wrong

testcase.classname: 3.2. Should verify fail when data is wrong

testcase.name: Verify Signature 3. Verify Set Type Of Token 3.3. Should verify successfully
testcase.classname: 3.3. Should verify successfully

testcase.name: ERC721 Integration 1.1. Mint token by paying native token => Transfer token => Owner of contract withdraws
testcase.classname: 1.1. Mint token by paying native token => Transfer token => Owner of contract withdraws

testcase.name: ERC721 Integration 1.2. Mint token by paying test cash token => Transfer token => Owner of contract withdraws
testcase.classname: 1.2. Mint token by paying test cash token => Transfer token => Owner of contract withdraws

testcase.name: ERC721 Integration 1.3. A user buys a token => Someone buys this token => Money will be transfered properly
testcase.classname: 1.3. A user buys a token => Someone buys this token => Money will be transfered properly
